revised_title: Thermal Emissivity of Thin Wires in Air: A Study on the Influence of Wire Diameter and Temperature
tldr: This article investigates the thermal emissivity of thin wires in air and how it changes with the wire's diameter and temperature. The authors found that the emissivity increases with a decrease in wire diameter and an increase in temperature. They also discovered that the emissivity of platinum wires of different diameters at the same temperature can be expressed by a constant plus a constant into the reciprocal of the wire's diameter. This research has implications for electrical engineers working with glow lamps, hot-wire voltmeters, and fuses.
